verses.verse: ((When Saul persecuted him, he called upon God, trusting most assuredly in his promise, and therefore boldly reproveth his enemies, who willfully resisted his dominion,7 and finally preferreth the favor of God before all worldly treasures.) Hear me when I call, (Thou that art the defender of my just cause.) O God of my righteousness: thou hast set me at liberty, when I was in (Both of mind and body.) distress: have mercy upon me, and hearken unto my prayer.

O ye (Ye that think yourselves noble in this world.) sons of men, how long will ye turn my glory into shame, (Though your enterprises please your never so much, yet God will bring them to nought.) loving vanity, and seeking lies? Selah.
For be ye sure that the Lord hath chosen to himself (A king that walketh in his vocation.) a godly man, the Lord will hear when I call unto him.
(For fear of God’s judgment.) Tremble and sin not: examine your own heart upon your bed, and be (Cease your rage.) still. Selah.
(Serve God purely, and not with outward ceremonies.) Offer the sacrifices of righteousness, and trust in the Lord.
Many say, Who will show us any (The multitude seek worldly wealth, but David setteth his felicity in God’s favor.) good? but Lord, lift up the light of thy countenance upon us.
Thou hast given me more joy of heart, than they have had, when their wheat and their wine did abound.

I will lay me down, and also sleep in peace: for thou, (This word in Hebrew may be referred to God, as it is here translated, or to David, signifying that he should dwell as joyful alone, as if he had many about him, because the Lord is with him.) Lord, only makest me dwell in safety.
